titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Karl Detlev Jessen (1872-1919) was a professor of German Literature at Bryn Mawr College from 1910 to 1919. He was involved with the Socialist movement in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Karl Jessen. The bulk of the material is in German. Papers include: incoming and outgoing correspondence between Jessen and his family, German publishers and socialist associations in the U.S. and Germany, and colleagues in the U.S. and Germany; scrapbooks and bibliographies of Jessen's writings; diaries kept by Jessen between 1899 and 1903; photographs; newspaper clippings; and diplomas.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
